ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So let him call his associates,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: So let him summon his helpmates;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Let him call on his associates for help
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So let him now call his gang!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then let him call upon his council.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then let him summon his council,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: So let him call on his concourse!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Then let him call upon his henchmen!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Then let him call his associates;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then, let him call his assembly,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Then let him call out his gang!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then, let him call (for help) to his council (of comrades):
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then, let him call upon his council (of helpers),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: So, let him call upon his way!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Let him call on his gang.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then let him call his associates;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [96:17] Let him, then, call upon [the henchmen of] his council, the members of his council (nādin) — a place of assembly where people gather to talk. He [Abū Jahl] had said to the Prophet (s) in reproof, having forbidden him from prayer, ‘You are well aware that there is none in this [town] who has [recourse to] as large a council [of men] as I do. Verily, I shall fill this [entire] valley with mature steeds and young men [in battle] against you if you so wish!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Then let him call upon his henchmen) his folk and companions!
